{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3423732,"name":"Brian Z","username":"BrianZ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brianz/{size}/11854_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-14T19:58:10.290Z","cooked":"

Hello CD, We are having some issues setting up our robot using YAGSL. We have the robot driving and turning sorta fine but when we try to drive full speed in one direction then slowdown a little and try to drive in another all the wheels kinda just freak out and spin to a random direction. Sometimes the wheels will turn into an X and all drive in to the center of the bot. We have been trying different PID values for turning and driving and all kinds of combos of inverting stuff while trying to trouble shoot.

Our code base started off using the example code from YAGSL. Our repo link : GitHub - Team-8841/OffSeasonBot2024

You modules didnt have the bevels facing the correct direction when you took the offsets. I have the proper diagram here. If that wasn’t the case your module locations are incorrect.

yagsl.gitbook.io

Configuration | YAGSL
